results.title: Germany: People of the industrial West
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Describes the life of people on Western Germany depicting them in a variety of occupations form the southern uplands to the Western plains in the country, village and city. Tells something of the history and cultural past of the Germans and gives an idea of life today in the major regions of Germany - the Rhineland, and uplands of the south, and the northern plains. Emphasizes the reconstruction of prosperity in spite of Germany’s war devastation and partition.

results.title: Germany of today
results.creator_credit: Clive Rees, G. Buckland-Smith and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the evolution of Germany from Charlemagne ti the present day. Stresses early disunity and rivalries of Emperor, Princes and Church. Unification in the 19th century; destruction in the Second World War followed by a rapid economic recovery, epitomised in the changing face of Bonn the new Federal Capital. Early history is portrayed in architecture, sculpture and art.

results.title: Germany of romance
results.brief_description: Accompanied by traditional music and the music of Wagner, Schumann, Brahms and Bach, the prospective tourist is shown the great man made and natural attractions of Germany and given glimpses of old and modern German life.

results.title: Germany and its shadow
results.creator_credit: Arthur Zegart and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: An assessment of the New Germany ranging from the country from Hamburg in the north to the Bavarian town of Landsberg, where Hitler wrote “Mein Kampf”. With its re-awakening forces of German Nationalism, is there a danger of Germany again being led down the familiar path to war?

results.title: The German sheepdog
results.creator_credit: EFVA and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: The life of sheepdogs on the central uplands of Germany. Shows how the dogs guard the sheep and lead them from pasture. Studies the main stages in the development of a litter from a week after birth. Gives an impression of the very different life of a dog that has been trained as a house dog. Intended for children aged 7-10.

results.title: George Bernard Shaw
results.creator_credit: Jan Read, Theodora Olembert and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: Using newsreel interviews and conversation with such people as Dame Sybil Thorndike and Kingsley Martin the film presents the personality of Shaw, the social critic whose plays cast a brilliant light on the political ideas struggling for expression at the turn of the century. Commentary by John van Eyssen and Tony Quinn.

results.title: A Geometry lesson
results.creator_credit: Virgilio Sabel, Carlo Ponti and Lux Film
results.brief_description: This Italian art film traces a relationship between the shapes of nature and the modern sculpture of the Henry Moore school. The film considers the geometrical lines of nature - the shapes and lines of the human body, the structure of crystals and the spiral lines of a snail’s shell - a combination of calculation and creative impulse. Art, by dint of instinct, approaches nature’s examples, thus widening the range of our eyes and our minds. (Award: Venice)

results.title: Geography of South America: the continent
results.brief_description: The main geographical features of South America, including the Andes, the Guiana and Brazilian highlands, and the Orinoco, Amazon and Plata-Parana River Basions. The relationships of these geographic factors to the people and their ways of life. Survey of agriculture, industry, commerce, cities and culture.

results.title: Geography of South America: Brazil
results.brief_description: The geographic features of Brazil and their relationship to such important crops as coffee, cotton and cacao; Brazil as a land of impenetrable jungle, fertile farmlands, gigantic plantations, rich mineral resources, thriving industry and big cities. Includes a sequence on Brasilia, the new capital.

results.title: Geography of South America: Argentina, Paraguay, Uraguay
results.brief_description: The geographic factors influencing the economy and life of Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay, pointing out that the three nations of the Plata-Parana River system are rich in flat and rolling lands suitable for farming and grazing. Some of the achievements and problems of these countries are also discussed.
